issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When concurrent snapshots are taken for a volume and a delta would be created the snapshot creation can fail:

{code}
# 
# 
# euca-create-volume -s 10 -z one
VOLUME	vol-9df431f6	10		one	creating	2017-01-12T17:41:08.041Z
# 
# 
# euca-describe-volumes vol-9df431f6
VOLUME	vol-9df431f6	10		one	available	2017-01-12T17:41:08.041Z	standard	
# 
# 
# euca-create-snapshot vol-9df431f6
SNAPSHOT	snap-7459633a	vol-9df431f6	pending	2017-01-12T17:41:27.778Z	000905817376	10	
# 
# 
# euca-describe-snapshots snap-7459633a
SNAPSHOT	snap-7459633a	vol-9df431f6	pending	2017-01-12T17:41:27.778Z	25%	000905817376	10	
# 
# 
# euca-describe-snapshots snap-7459633a
SNAPSHOT	snap-7459633a	vol-9df431f6	completed	2017-01-12T17:41:27.778Z	100%	000905817376	10	
# 
# 
# euca-create-snapshot vol-9df431f6 & euca-create-snapshot vol-9df431f6 & euca-create-snapshot vol-9df431f6 & 
[1] 29453
[2] 29454
[3] 29455
# SNAPSHOT	snap-32fa6b6b	vol-9df431f6	pending	2017-01-12T17:47:36.501Z	000905817376	10	
SNAPSHOT	snap-0c694db1	vol-9df431f6	pending	2017-01-12T17:47:36.499Z	000905817376	10	
SNAPSHOT	snap-23441acd	vol-9df431f6	pending	2017-01-12T17:47:36.501Z	000905817376	10	

[1]   Done                    euca-create-snapshot vol-9df431f6
[2]-  Done                    euca-create-snapshot vol-9df431f6
[3]+  Done                    euca-create-snapshot vol-9df431f6
# 
# 
# euca-describe-snapshots snap-32fa6b6b snap-0c694db1 snap-23441acd
SNAPSHOT	snap-0c694db1	vol-9df431f6	failed	2017-01-12T17:47:36.499Z	0%	000905817376	10	
SNAPSHOT	snap-32fa6b6b	vol-9df431f6	completed	2017-01-12T17:47:36.501Z	100%	000905817376	10	
SNAPSHOT	snap-23441acd	vol-9df431f6	completed	2017-01-12T17:47:36.501Z	100%	000905817376	10	
# 
#
{code}

Error from the storage controller cloud-error.log:

{code}
Thu Jan 12 09:47:38 2017 ERROR [SnapshotCreator:eucalyptus-storage-snapshotcreator-worker-888] [com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.async.SnapshotCreator.run(SnapshotCreator.java):314] Failed to create snapshot snap-0c694db1
com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Failed to generate snapshot delta between snap-0c694db1 and snap-32fa6b6b
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.ceph.CephRbdProvider.generateSnapshotDelta(CephRbdProvider.java:631)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.san.common.SANManager.prepIncrementalSnapshotForUpload(SANManager.java:1161)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.async.SnapshotCreator.run(SnapshotCreator.java:258)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Unable to execute rbd command. return=22, stdout=, stderr=
Exporting image: 0% complete...failed.
rbd: export-diff error: (22) Invalid argument

        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.ceph.CephRbdProvider.generateSnapshotDelta(CephRbdProvider.java:615)
        ... 5 more
{code}

This does not occur on every attempt, but seems easy to reproduce.

A possible work around is to reduce snapshot concurrency to 1 for the zone:

{code}
#
# euctl one.storage.maxconcurrentsnapshots=1
one.storage.maxconcurrentsnapshots = 1
#
{code}

We should ensure that concurrent creation of snapshots from a volume are handled correctly.
fields.summary: Snapshot delta fails for concurrent snapshots of volume

comments.body: I have verified the problem on a cloud that uses Ceph, for snapshot deltas, using [~sjones]'s steps. Doing the same concurrent snaps without deltas works fine, no errors.

Summary:

# Creating multiple Ceph snapshots on the same volume concurrently sometimes fails (~25%). This is a Ceph bug/limitation unrelated to Euca, and unrelated to snapshot deltas.
# Our Euca snapshot code is not serializing creation of snapshots as it should, when maxconcurrentsnapshots is set to 1, at least when deltas are enabled. It might be ignoring that property altogether.

Details:
1: When it fails, you can see the error message if you do the "rbd" command manually:
{{librbd: adding snapshot to header failed: (116) Stale file handle}}
...but it returns a return code of 0 (ok) at the command line, so you'd have to parse the output to find this error.

The Ceph rbd Java library method that our Java code calls is a void method, and does not throw any Java exception when this type of failure occurs. So we have no way of knowing that it failed this way, unless we replace the Java library call with a CLI command (which we already do for the export-diff command), and parse the output.

When this failure happens, the subsequent protect and clone phases still succeed, but the export-diff phase fails with the error shown in the Description here. 

We could AssUMe that the return code 22 and output from export-diff means that we had this type of snapshot creation failure, and handle it that way, but it would be better to catch the creation failure when it's created.

2: The Euca concurrency issue is shown in the previous comment here.

Plan:
1: Replace the rbd library call with a CLI command, and parse the output to find this error. Also, either:

1a: (easy but non-optimal) Retry creating a snapshot if it fails, up to a configurable timeout or number of retries.
Retrying the creation of a snapshot is not a good answer, when the failure rate is 25% in our EQS lab. It could be higher or lower in other deployments. At 25%, retrying 3 more times quadruples the time it could take to do a snap, and still leaves a 0.4% chance of the snapshot failing, so 1 in 250 snapshots will still fail. The snapshotter (user) will be notified, but that doesn't help if there's an automated cron script making snapshots. A user will still have to review the script logs to see if any snapshots failed.

1b: (TBD difficulty but optimal) Synchronize Ceph snapshots on the same volume even if maxconcurrentsnapshots is >1. Concurrent snaps on different volumes would be allowed. Then we should never see the Ceph error (famous last words).

2: (TBD difficulty) Fix snapshot concurrency code to honor maxconcurrentsnapshots.

I'm attaching the scripts and execution outputs that show the issues.

As for why we see this only with snapshot deltas, it's because the Ceph rbd export-diff command returns an error, which causes Euca to fail the snapshot. Because no error is returned from Ceph to Euca when a snapshot creation fails in this way, we report no error if we don't do a delta. So this error was happening before deltas. But, the snapshot is created despite this error, and it doesn't seem to affect using the snapshot, e.g. cloning or reverting. It only affects the export-diff (delta), and perhaps other Ceph operations we don't use.
[^EUCA-13114-scripts-outputs-1.txt]

Update: the "Stale file handle" error message is not always returned in the output for a Ceph snap that fails this way and then causes export-diff to fail. So we may not even be able to rely on this to detect this failure at snapshot creation time, and we'll only have the export-diff failure to indicate it.
[~lincoln.thomas], thank you for the in-depth investigation and analysis. I think we need to have blocking snapshot creations for Ceph if it does not support parallel snapshotting for a volume.

After discussion with [~vasya], I will:
# Add code to serialize the snapshot creations for Ceph, regardless of the maxconcurrentsnapshots setting. 
# Investigate why maxconcurrentsnapshots does not seem to be honored by Euca's snap code (independent of deltas) and fix it. Currently it appears that snap creations are always concurrent with no limits.

Additionally: It never makes sense to do concurrent snapshot deltas on a volume. It looks up the latest 2 snapshots. If run concurrently, we can get out of order, e.g.:
(based on when snapshots complete)
{noformat}
base, snap1, snap2: make delta of snap1-->snap2
base, snap1, snap2, snap4: make delta of snap2-->snap4
base, snap1, snap2, snap3, snap4: make delta of snap3-->snap4
{noformat}

1. is fixed, in final regression testing.
2. The property maxconcurrentsnapshots is already honored for cloning a snapshot, snapping the clone, and uploading the snapshot (full or delta) to OSG. But it's not honored for the step of Ceph creating the snapshot which happens before these operations, before the SnapshotCreator task is launched in the snapshot thread pool. Any number of threads can still Ceph-snapshot different volumes at the same time. Fixing that is underway.

2. is fixed now too, at the BlockStorageController level, so it will apply to all back-ends (SANs and Ceph), to prevent any such problems in those other providers.

Needs regression testing on all storage back-ends.

Needs code review by [~sjones] and [~spark] for verifying the semaphore logic, in light of other block storage semaphore issues EUCA-13123 and EUCA-13084.
See pull request https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/pull/91

[~lincoln.thomas], the acquire for a semaphore should be before the "try" is entered as you do not want to release if the acquire fails.

EucaSemaphoreDirectory should not be used for the snapshot concurrency limit, direct use of a (java) Semaphore  with lazy init would be simpler (e.g. Suppliers#memoize)

I would use trace level logging rather than debug for the createSnapshotPoint acquire/release.

[~lincoln.thomas], looks good. I don't think this is an issue in practice for this usage. If making other changes it would be good to update but I don't think we should change this in other areas for 4.4 (we have a 5.0 bug to do cleanup)
[~lincoln.thomas] Oops ignore my comment. It was not a race condition. Sorry for confusion.

Fixes made for comments above, tests passing. See pull request https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/pull/91.
[~sjones], OK now?

Helpful test scripts and usage here: https://gist.github.com/lincolnthomas/50906cfc2ec4c2bb75552c468278a719

Also, to see the order of semaphore acquires and releases:

{noformat}
euctl cloud.euca_log_level=TRACE
grep semaphore cloud-debug.log
{noformat}
You may have to grep {{cloud-debug.log.1}} or earlier ones since logs will wrap quickly on TRACE mode.
[~lincoln.thomas], looks good to me.
Commit f4d0c0b9b6433687505d767a271217d2eafbc353 merged in my branch commits.

I was able to created 4 snapshots from the same volume "in parallel" with one.storage.maxsnapshotdeltas set to 5.

RPM: eucalyptus-4.4.0-0.25782.145.20170131git1addb15.el7.x86_64
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
